etymologies: late Middle English (as a medical term denoting colic or in the sense ‘twisting’ (especially of a loop of the intestine)): via Old French from late Latin torsio(n-), variant of tortio(n-) ‘twisting, torture’, from Latin torquere ‘to twist’

definitions: the action of twisting or the state of being twisted, especially of one end of an object relative to the other.
the extent to which a curve departs from being planar.
shortDefinitions: extent to which curve departs from being planar

definitions: (in a gastropod mollusk) the spontaneous twisting of the visceral hump through 180° during larval development.
shortDefinitions: (in gastropod mollusc) spontaneous twisting of visceral hump through 180° during larval development
